content:
Nice clash, but I noted a couple of issues.

1. You don't mention in the statement what would happen if  the current date "U" was 15. Your solution code wouldn't include any money from this paycheck in the calculation, but since there are no tests with this edge case it doesn't really make a difference. The issue is just that clashers don't know how to handle it if it comes up in validators, so might waste time unsure of what to code it as. You could specify [[U]] is never 15 in the constraints, perhaps? That would remove the concern.

2. I got this in a Shortest mode clash and someone submitted the below Ruby code and got 100% even though it's an incorrect solution and doesn't even consider the current date "U" or that there are 30 days in a month:
d,x,t,u=gets.split.map(&:to_i);e=d*(t/15)
puts e>0?e>=x ? true : false : "ruined"

This shows that your tests/validators aren't sufficient to weed out incorrect solutions. Part of the issue is the "almost" binary output, so even if the calculations are wrong there's at worst a 50-50 chance of getting the right answer mostly.

A test case that would fail for that code above would be any with t < 15 that gives true as the answer.
e.g.
1000 700 14 3 => true
1300 1000 4 13 => true

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: It's not too difficult, even for beginners! Looks good to me
It would be better to use the int type in the stub generator input. This way, coders don't need to write extra string-to-integer conversions themselves.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Quite funny and not too complicated.

hi, another typo problem
"if he don't have.." -> "if he doesn't have"

Otherwise good puzzle for clash of code, easy to do

There are a few typos in the testcases names:

"Easilly buyable" --> "Easily buyable"
"Price to high" --> "Price too high"
"Very low price ans salary" --> "Very low price and salary"

1. "true" and "false" should be formatted as constants instead of variables.

2. Binary output should be avoided as per contribution guidelines. In your clash, there are only two possible outputs: true / false, making that binary output. Please update your clash so that there are >2 possible outputs.
https://www.codingame.com/playgrounds/40701/help-center/contribution-guidelines

3. Your contribution has been uploaded twice, please delete one of them.

Thanks.
